frontmatter.title: Chapter 1: Getting started
frontmatter.description: This chapter will teach you about many cool things about R and RStuduo and help you get start with RStudio.

frontmatter.title: Chapter 2: R Programming Basics
frontmatter.description: In R Programming Basics, you will master the basic operations of this popular open source language. You will also learn to perform simple algebraic operations on vectors and matrices. You will also learn about data frames, conditional statements, loops, and functions to power your R code, making your work more efficient and elegant.

frontmatter.title: Chapter 3: How to ask for help
frontmatter.description: Places to find help with troubleshooting R, useful resources, and how ask clear questions with minimally reproducible examples.

frontmatter.title: Chapter 4: Project Structure
frontmatter.description: This chapter will teach you the basic project structure and good practice of project management in R.

frontmatter.title: Chapter 5: Importing and exporting data
frontmatter.description: This chapter will show you how to import data from different sources including csv files, excel files and files hosted online

frontmatter.title: Chapter 6: Data Wrangling
frontmatter.description: In this chapter, you will learn to use tidyr and dplyr from the tidyverse in R.

frontmatter.title: Chapter 7: Data Visualisation with R
frontmatter.description: This chapter will give you an introduction to the R graphics system and teach you how to get started with using the ggplot2 package for drawing all kind of plots.
